  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) -3% AH in response to Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) weak FQ3...

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) -3% AH in response to Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) weak FQ3 report and guidance. During its earnings call, Starbucks claimed it has shipped over 350M K-Cups since November, and now has a 20% share of the single-cup coffee market. However, it also said margins for the division responsible for K-Cups have fallen due to higher commodity costs.

    More on Brightcove's Q2: Total customers +10% Q/Q and +43% Y/Y to 4,697. The company expects...

    More on Brightcove's Q2: Total customers +10% Q/Q and +43% Y/Y to 4,697. The company expects 2012 revenue of $85.3M-$86M and EPS of -$0.44 to -$0.47, above a consensus $82M and -$0.48. Also, Brightcove announces it's acquiring Zencoder, provider of an online video encoding service, for $30M. ZenCoder's service leverages HTML5 rather than Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) Flash, has over 1,000 customers, and meshes well with Brightcove's video hosting service. BCOV +19.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • SBUX

    From Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ3 conference call: After earlier sending execs to the "problem...

    From Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ3 conference call: After earlier sending execs to the "problem spot" of Western Europe, it will close unprofitable stores on the continent over the rest of the year. Despite an EPS miss, CEO Howard Schultz would take Q3's comp-store growth (7% U.S.; 6% global) "any quarter over the 41-year history of the company." Lower Q4 numbers are a "very conservative approach" but execs believe strongly in 15-20% growth guidance for 2013, with expectations to benefit from lower commodity costs. Shares now -10.3% AH. (earnings; call transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM | 1 Comment

    More on Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK): Q2 beats consensus estimates as the company reports a...

    More on Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK): Q2 beats consensus estimates as the company reports a lower-than-anticipated loss for the quarter. Revenue rose 13% on a 25% increase in sales at its retail outlets and a 40% jump in online sales. Key brand sales however, continue to be sluggish. Its UGG-brand boots reported sales of $108M, -0.3% Y/Y, while Teva-brand sandals -15.4% to $34M. Shares are +15.1% AH.

  • OUTR

    More on Coinstar's Q2: The revenue miss was due to Redbox sales (affected by seasonality)...

    More on Coinstar's Q2: The revenue miss was due to Redbox sales (affected by seasonality) falling 9% Q/Q to $458M. Guidance (accounts for NCR deal) is mostly in-line. Coinstar expects Q3 revenue of $550M-$575M and EPS of $1.09-$1.24 vs. a consensus of $545M and $1.17. It expects 2012 revenue of $2.21B-$2.31B and EPS of $4.60-$4.90 vs. a consensus of $2.28B and $4.74. Between Coinstar's figures and Netflix's, DVD rental demand appears to be softening. CSTR -12.7% AH. (PR)

    More on Acme Packet's (NASDAQ:APKT) Q2: The company is guiding for 2012 revenue of $270M-$275M...

    More on Acme Packet's (NASDAQ:APKT) Q2: The company is guiding for 2012 revenue of $270M-$275M and EPS of $0.43-$0.47, well below a consensus of $295.9M and $0.70. No explanation is given in the PR. It was only 3 weeks ago that Acme issued a major Q2 warning, citing weak North American service provider capex. Shares -15.9% AH, making new multi-year lows in the process.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • GILD

    More on Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q2 beats across the board on a 14% rise in total revenue....

    More on Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q2 beats across the board on a 14% rise in total revenue. Product sales - the company's leading revenue generator - rose 14% in the latest period. Sales of antiviral products, its dominant revenue stream, also increased 14% as HIV drugs Atripla and Truvada both saw sales increases of 10%. Royalty revenue decreased however, down 14% for the quarter. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM

    More on Expedia's Q2: Strong results fueled by 20% Y/Y increase in transactions of 23.1M (Q1 had...

    More on Expedia's Q2: Strong results fueled by 20% Y/Y increase in transactions of 23.1M (Q1 had 18% growth). Hotel room nights +22%, revenue per room night -5%. Air tickets sold +3%, revenue per air ticket -11%. International revenue 38% of total, even with prior year. Cost of revenue +17%, outpacing revenue growth. 3M shares repurchased at average price of $33.24. EXPE +12.1% AH. PCLN +1.9%. TRIP +2.5%. (PR)

    More on Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN): Q2 beats across the board on a 13% Y/Y jump in total revenue....

    More on Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN): Q2 beats across the board on a 13% Y/Y jump in total revenue. Product sales growth was driven by strong performance across the portfolio. Xgeva sales total: $179M. For 2012, the company guides higher, now seeing an EPS of $6.20 to $6.35 on revenue of $16.9B to $17.2B. Street estimates are for earnings of $6.15 per share on $16.37B in revenue. Shares +4.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • FB

    More on Facebook's Q2: Monthly active users (MAUs) were 955M at end of June, +6% Q/Q and +29%...

    More on Facebook's Q2: Monthly active users (MAUs) were 955M at end of June, +6% Q/Q and +29% Y/Y. Mobile MAUs were 543M, +11% Q/Q and +67% Y/Y. Ad revenue +14% Q/Q and +28% Y/Y (was 37% in Q1), 84% of total. Payments revenue +3% Q/Q (no Y/Y data), indicating a major slowdown. Capex +213% Y/Y to $413M. Operating cash flow of $129M, -47%. R&D and sales/marketing expenses up significantly. FB reverses course, now -8.7%. ZNGA -4.6%. (PR; call transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 18 Comments

    More on Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN): Operating income -46.8% Y/Y. Service sales up 57% Y/Y and now...

    More on Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN): Operating income -46.8% Y/Y. Service sales up 57% Y/Y and now account for 16% of revenue. Employee headcount of 69.1K, +60% Y/Y. Q3 sales guidance represents 19-31% Y/Y sales growth (vs. 29% in Q2). Company expects a Q3 operating loss of $50-350M vs. $79M profit a year earlier. Shares cutting losses, -2.5% AH. Conference call at 5 ET. (PR)

    More from Starbucks' FQ3 miss: The firm lowers guidance for FQ4 to EPS of $0.44-$0.45 (vs....

    More from Starbucks' FQ3 miss: The firm lowers guidance for FQ4 to EPS of $0.44-$0.45 (vs. $0.48) and revenue growth of 10-12% to "reflect the difficult economic environment all global retailers are confronting today," but affirms earnings growth of 15-20% in fiscal 2013. U.S. same-store sales up 7%; global up 6%. SBUX now -8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 14 Comments

    | 4:06 PM | 24 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -5.4%) takes out its 52-week low as the Street continues weighing the implications...

    Netflix (NFLX -5.4%) takes out its 52-week low as the Street continues weighing the implications of the company's Q2 report, and the poor guidance accompanying it. "The Netflix story is a simple one. The company had a huge competitive advantage in the DVD rental market. It has none in the digital streaming market," asserts Needham (Underperform), which is slashing its 2013 EPS estimate to $0.60 from $2.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • CBK

    Christopher & Banks (CBK +23.4%) expects a Q2 sales decline, but shares soar as the apparel...

    Christopher & Banks (CBK +23.4%) expects a Q2 sales decline, but shares soar as the apparel retailer defends its turnaround plan and cites improvements in same-store sales. CEO Joel Waller says marketing strategies are beginning to show progress, while better in-store presentation and staff improvements also are boosting performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • VAR

    Varian Medical (VAR -6.3%) trades lower after its FQ3 beats on a per share basis but comes up...

    Varian Medical (VAR -6.3%) trades lower after its FQ3 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue. Margins improved sequentially, but orders came in weak and the company says its facing significant currency headwinds, prompting it to reduce guidance for the current quarter. Cantor cuts the shares to Hold on the report, citing a litany of issues, including: slowing hospital capex, concerns over Europe and lack of visibility over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • AMZN

    Whole Foods (WFM +11.5%) surges 10%-plus after it reported strong Q2 results and raised 2012...

    Whole Foods (WFM +11.5%) surges 10%-plus after it reported strong Q2 results and raised 2012 guidance; today, at least four analysts hike price targets for the stock. S&P Capital IQ loves the balance sheet and sees same-store sales "growing in upper single digits through FY 2013 with share gains reflecting consumer adoption of a healthier lifestyle."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • NLY

    Annaly (NLY -0.5%) investors may want to pay attention to the meltdown in the shares of Chimera...

    Annaly (NLY -0.5%) investors may want to pay attention to the meltdown in the shares of Chimera Investment (CIM -8.7%) on the back of an SA article suggesting the firm (which hasn't filed an earnings release or financial information since 2011 Q3) could be headed towards a $0 dividend and/or delisting. Annaly owns a sizable chunk of Chimera and manages the company through a subsidiary.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 23 Comments
  • HSY

    Hershey (HSY +1.6%) may need to generate $1B in annual revenue from acquisitions to reach its...

    Hershey (HSY +1.6%) may need to generate $1B in annual revenue from acquisitions to reach its goal of $10B in sales within five years, CEO John Bilbrey says. HSY seeks to build distribution in emerging economies where it can boost sales to growing middle-class populations; it sees $30B of M&A potential in the highly fragmented global confection and snack market.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • KEM

    Kemet (KEM -9%) slides after its FQ1 misses Street consensus estimates earlier today. Revenue...

    Kemet (KEM -9%) slides after its FQ1 misses Street consensus estimates earlier today. Revenue beat slightly, but bottom line results were hammered by higher operating and restructuring costs, and nearly a 23% decline in total revenue. Additionally, the company says it will be cutting 420 employees globally, representing 4% of its workforce, and take a $7M charge to the current quarter to cover severance expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet's (FTNT +12.6%) lofty multiples become loftier after the company delivers a top-line Q2...

    Fortinet's (FTNT +12.6%) lofty multiples become loftier after the company delivers a top-line Q2 beat, and uses its earnings call to hike guidance. Fortinet, the top player in the growing UTM security hardware space, now expects 2012 billings of $590M-$600M, up from a prior $580M-$590M. Revenue is expected to total $525M-$530M (consensus is for $525.5M), while Q3 revenue and EPS are expected to be in-line. EMEA sales rose 19% Y/Y. CHKP +3.3%. FIRE +3.6%. PANW +1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy (BAS +8.3%) isn't the only oil service stock (OIH +3.6%) benefiting from a Goldman...

    Basic Energy (BAS +8.3%) isn't the only oil service stock (OIH +3.6%) benefiting from a Goldman Sachs upgrade, as Pioneer Drilling (PDC +14.3%) and Schlumberger (SLB +4%) are lifted to Buy from Neutral (I, II). The firm says consensus views are missing key trends in the sector, including stabilizing oil and gas prices plus strengthening international land trends.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (INFA +3.2%) is rallying ahead of this afternoon's Q2 report, thanks to an upgrade...

    Informatica (INFA +3.2%) is rallying ahead of this afternoon's Q2 report, thanks to an upgrade to Buy from Roth Capital. The data warehousing software vendor crashed 3 weeks ago after issuing a huge warning, and shares closed yesterday near their 52-week low.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • GPRE

    Green Plains Renewable Energy (GPRE -11%) slides after posting Q2 per share losses that were far...

    Green Plains Renewable Energy (GPRE -11%) slides after posting Q2 per share losses that were far greater than expected, despite a slight improvement in revenue. Revenue increased marginally during the quarter, due largely to higher profits in its corn oil production and agribusiness segments, but bottom line results were hammered by higher operating expenses and reduced ethanol production due to less-than-favorable operating margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • GRPN

    In addition to the Zynga train wreck, Groupon (GRPN -7.7%) is falling due to a downgrade to...

    In addition to the Zynga train wreck, Groupon (GRPN -7.7%) is falling due to a downgrade to Equalweight from Evercore's Ken Sena. Sena, who upgraded Groupon in April, is worried about both Groupon's performance - he thinks North American and international billings are "trending well below consensus" - and trustworthiness. He believes Groupon's Q1 beat was due to sales from Groupon Goods rather than improved daily deals performance, as the company claimed in May.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • XOM

    Exxon (XOM +1.3%) has missed its targets in back-to-back quarters, and oil-equivalent production...

    Exxon (XOM +1.3%) has missed its targets in back-to-back quarters, and oil-equivalent production remains flat, but it is making strides to improve production in future quarters, an Edward Jones analyst says. In its conference call, XOM said it's now operating 10 rigs in the Bakken shale field and efforts to produce oil out of its Kizomba project in Angola are running ahead of schedule.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • ANTM
